title: 2009 AFC Champions League Final
text:
The 2009 AFC Champions League Final was a <a href="Association%20football">football</a> match which was played on Saturday, 7 November 2009. It was the 28th final of the <a href="AFC%20Champions%20League">AFC Champions League</a>, Asia's premier club football tournament, and the first single match final since 2002 when the competition was known as the Asian Club Championship. The match was played at the <a href="National%20Stadium%20%28Tokyo%2C%201958%29">National Stadium</a> in <a href="Tokyo">Tokyo</a> and it was contested between <a href="Al-Ittihad%20%28Jeddah%29">Al-Ittihad</a> of <a href="Saudi%20Arabia%20Football%20Federation">Saudi Arabia</a> and <a href="Pohang%20Steelers">Pohang Steelers</a> of <a href="Korea%20Football%20Association">South Korea</a>. The winners <a href="Pohang%20Steelers">Pohang Steelers</a> were also entered the quarter-finals of the <a href="2009%20FIFA%20Club%20World%20Cup">2009 FIFA Club World Cup</a>. 
<a href="Pohang%20Steelers">Pohang Steelers</a> defeated <a href="Al-Ittihad%20%28Jeddah%29">Al-Ittihad</a> 2–1, winning its third title to become the most successful club in <a href="Asian%20Football%20Confederation">Asian football</a>.
